result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhian D McCradic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental Health Assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment, including prescribed medications.
Participate in a cognitive behavioral program, to include any trauma related treatment.
Full time work, school, or a combination.
No Contact w/ the victim's family.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored
Defendant informed he may not possess any dangerous weapons or firearms

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rhian D McCradic in court in person, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court in person for Rhian D McCradic.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court in person for Rhian D McCradic.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by:
.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 24 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 14 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
Mental Health Assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment, including prescribed medications
Participate in a cognitive behavioral program, to include any trauma related treatment
Full time work, school, or a combination
No Contact w/ the victim's family 

Credit given for 166 days time served.

Defendant informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored
Defendant informed he may not possess any dangerous weapons or firearms 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant.
Sentencing Memorandum and Court Report, Received and Filed

Defendant Rhian D McCradic in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Taylor and Nathan Opland-Dobbs in court with Rhian D McCradic.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing.  No PSI requested.  Defense to provide a sentencing memo.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Rhian D McCradic in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor and Nathan Opland-Dobbs.  Defendant Rhian D McCradic in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense is requesting modification of the bail to $15,000.  State objects and place reasons on the record.  Court DENIES the motion.

Defense request a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Bail Review Motion
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Rhian D McCradic not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Defense counsel requests additional adjournment for scheduling.

Court orders case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 15.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Rhian D McCradic in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Rhian D McCradic in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Michael Fidel.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor and Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Rhian D McCradic not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. State ready to proceed. Defendant refuses to come to court. Court adjourns matter to allow time for the defense counsels to speak wiht client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with DW
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Rhian D McCradic
Current: 5123 W Lincoln Creek Dr, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 2485 South 5th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rhian D McCradic in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Rhian D McCradic in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rhian D McCradic appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
